2016/KER/33655
B. KEMAL PASHA, J.
ee ee ee
ORDER

Petitioner is the sole accused in C.C.No.707 of 2011 of
the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court, Karunagappally,
for the offences punishable under Sections 468 and 471 of
the Indian Penal Code and Section 12(b) of the Passports
Act, 1967.

2. The petitioner has sought for getting the
prosecution proceedings against the petitioner quashed on
two grounds. The first ground is that sanction of the Central
Government, as contemplated under Section 15 of the
Passports Act, has not been obtained and therefore, the
prosecution proceedings shall not lie as far as the offence
under the Passports Act is concerned.

3. AS per Section 15 of the Passports Act, no
prosecution shall be instituted against any person in respect

eee
2016/KER/33655
CRL.M.C.No. 628 of 2015 uoe
of any offences under the Act, without the previous sanction
of the Central Government. When it has come out that no
sanction was obtained, the offence under the Passports Act
will not lie and therefore, the same is liable to be quashed.

4. With regard to the offences under the IPC, the
learned counsel for the petitioner has pointed out that at the
time of the alleged commission of the offence, the petitioner
was a juvenile. Hence, the petitioner can only be considered
as a juvenile in conflict with law. Therefore, the matter has
to be reported before the Juvenile Justice Board. The
prosecution proceedings based on Annexure 2 final report in
C.C.No.707/2011 of the Judicial First Class Magistrate's
Court, Karunagappally, as far as the petitioner is concerned,
are liable to be quashed.

In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed and the
prosecution proceedings based on Annexure 2 final report in
C.C.No.707/2011 of the Judicial First Class Magistrate's
Court, Karunagappally, as far as the petitioner is concerned,

Pre ao)
apo
2016/KER/33655
CRL.M.C.No. 628 of 2015
3:
are hereby quashed. It is made clear that this Order will not
stand in the way of the investigating officer to report the
matter before the Juvenile Justice Board.
Sd/- B. KEMAL PASHA, JUDGE.
